people.name: Jens Hilgers
people.description: Jens started BITKRAFT in 2015 after the acquisition of esports juggernaut ESL, which he founded in 2000. Playing Minecraft with his two sons is where heâ€™s happiest.

people.name: Malte Barth
people.description: Malte has been a leader, investor, and operator in the media, games, and esports spaces for over 20 years. Wherever he is at this exact moment, he'd probably rather be kitesurfing.

people.name: Scott Rupp
people.description: Interactive entertainment entrepreneur, investor, and operating executive with over 20 years experience. He'd like you to know the Nuggets are NBA champions.

people.name: Martin Garcia
people.description: Responsible for all operational and financial activities, Martin leverages experience from work across almost 20 countries. He is a proud graduate of the Kauffman Fellows Program.

people.name: Jasper Brand
people.description: Jasper was part of BITKRAFT's founding team, and currently focuses on identifying and evaluating new investment opportunities. High probability he could beat you in golf.

people.name: Adrian Galea
people.description: Adrian is a finance and legal services professional experienced in regulatory and taxation matters, and is responsible for tracking the portfolio. Best accent at BITKRAFT.

people.name: Piers Kicks
people.description: Piers is Founding Partner in the investment arm of the leading institutional research firm covering the digital asset marketâ€”Delphi Digital. Acquired his first bitcoin at 13.

people.name: Sebastian Park
people.description: Former VP of Esports at Houston Rockets, Seb was the first dedicated esports front-office executive in North America and in the NBA. Can talk knowledgeably about nearly anything.

people.name: Carlos Pereira
people.description: Leading BITKRAFT's crypto strategy, Carlos is an experienced investor with a background in gaming, media, and interactive entertainment. He believes Call of Duty is the new golf.

people.name: Mariana Guiterrez
people.description: Mariana manages communications with investors, advisors, and portfolio companies, with international experience in global banking and VC.

people.name: Dennis Fong
people.description: Founder & CEO with â‰ˆ $1B in exits in gaming and SaaS, and currently the co-founder & CEO of ggwp. Better known to some as "Thresh", he is literally the world's first pro gamer.

people.name: Antonio de la Esperanza
people.description: Antonio is BITKRAFT's legal counsel and brings with him extensive experience in cross-border debt and venture financing. A bad but enthusiastic gamer and golfer.

people.name: Jamie Wallace
people.description: A deep believer in the power of blockchain, Jamie is focused on identifying and evaluating new investment opportunities in Web3 / crypto. Resident Canadian. Literal Olympian.

people.name: Oliver Stad
people.description: Oliver is responsible for tracking financials and key performance metrics in service of potential follow-on rounds and portfolio allocation. Techno-optimist and skilled pianist.

people.name: Becky Harold
people.description: Becky supports the operations team across all of its core functions, driving many of the day-to-day priorities of the firm. Low-key is the most interesting person at BITKRAFT.

people.name: Ben Naylor
people.description: A rare blend of technical and creative, a former sound engineer and software developer turned analyst, Ben's insights inform deal decision-making. Probably the nicest person here.

people.name: Nico Vereecke
people.description: Identifies and evaluates new investments in gaming and crypto, and has previously built multiple crypto and fintech startups. CrossFit trainer who leads fun(?) offsite workouts.

people.name: Brooke Grabrian
people.description: Brooke cultivates strategies and frameworks for highly successful people organizations across talent, culture and HR at BITKRAFT and within the portfolio. We don't deserve her.

people.name: Justin Swart
people.description: Justin comes from a background in IB and VC, and carries a deep passion for being able to work with entrepreneurs in pursuit of their dreams. His grey hair is not Witcher cosplay.

people.name: Amanda Timm
people.description: Career tech & gaming recruiter focused on streamlining operations and developing meaningful DE&I strategies in support of our portfolio. Unconvinced she's not actually Batgirl.

people.name: Jin Oh
people.description: Jin leads BITKRAFT's Asia strategy and operations, and is formerly President of Riot Games. Not listed on his LinkedIn is his ability to toss a bean bag with extreme precision.

people.name: Jonathan  Huang
people.description: Jonathan is responsible for supporting the entire investment process from origination to evaluation, structuring, and closing within the Asia region. Secretly part Witcher.

people.name: Candace  Kim
people.description: Equal part creative and analytical, Candace is a strategist with a background in gaming, digital entertainment, and tech. She's looking for the perfect iced Americano as we speak.

people.name: Kevin Robertson
people.description: Kevin leads network and ecosystems within the BITKRAFT orbit, facilitating internal and external network communications in the process. Hair and kindness are both S-tier.

people.name: Sven Hoffmann
people.description: A veteran of global Esports events production having spent nearly 20 years at ESL. Tattoo game is A+.

people.name: Peter Pilone
people.description: Peter brings unique game development experience to the BITKRAFT team, where he identifies and evaluates content and infrastructure investment opportunities. Horror film buff.
